alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Randolph (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 19 at 3:10PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Delaware and northwestern Randolph Counties through 345 PM EST... At 310 PM EST, trained weather spotters reported a strong thunderstorm near Albany, or 9 miles south of Dunkirk, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Delaware and northwestern Randolph Counties, including the following locations... Farmland, Parker City, Albany, Ridgeville and Selma. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EST for east central Indiana.
